description.narrative: Support to local security action plans through social cohesion and civic engagement initiatives.

1. Number of LSC members trained on conflict management & dialogue facilitation
2.1 Number of focus groups held with key stakeholders to update the local security assessments 2.2 Number of key stakeholders involved in the local security diagnosis 2.3 Number of assessment of the conflict dynamics in the 8 targeted communities
3.1 Number of civil society initiatives engaged with internal security forces and local authorities in the identification and implementation of activities aimed at preventing crime, violent extremism and SGBV in 12 localities. 3.2 Public reached by local CSO’s activities to support LSC & promote community policing approach 3.3 Women involved in awareness campaigns, social, cultural & artistic activities to implement local security action plans & prevent violent extremism and SGBC
4.1 Number of spaces for dialogue and debate held by LSC 4.2 Number youth engaged in dialogue with LSC’s members and ISF representatives on ways to improve relations between youth and police 4.3 Study on youth expectations & recommendations to improve trust on police forces
